channel.title: Runescape Classic combat/rules in rs2/3 Engine
channel.description:
Only if you would play it post in this thread.
a few of the rules include:
no movement during combat
no eating during combat
range mage attacks from others at any time during combat
running disabled
a delay when exiting combat before re-entering combat

item.title: Runescape Classic combat/rules in rs2/3 Engine
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Just allow for armour to not change spell damage

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Classic combat/rules in rs2/3 Engine
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If someone could tell me all the combat rules I could incorperate it into something like a minigame, or maybe make like a toggle where you can switch between classic/rs2.
I really wasn’t around for the rsc area… I joined like right when rs2 came out.

Read full topic

item.source: Runescape Classic combat/rules in rs2/3 Engine

item.title: Runescape Classic combat/rules in rs2/3 Engine
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“latifundio, post:5, topic:549318”]Looks good if is it for fp2, but what about the 3 hit rule? with weapons faster than others maybe use 4 seconds for fleeing from combat?

[quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=668223.msg4468986#msg4468986 date=1421881348]

Well put differently, you would either always be running or always walking. The key point is that you don’t have an advantage because you happen to have higher energy than the person you’re chasing or being chased by in combat.

also we could make it that movement is only standard walking in the wilderness as thats where catching and movement matter.
[/quote] walking is too slow on rs2, just set it running for all[/quote]
no weapon speeds they would get values based on power.

Read full topic
item.source: Runescape Classic combat/rules in rs2/3 Engine

Well put differently, you would either always be running or always walking. The key point is that you don’t have an advantage because you happen to have higher energy than the person you’re chasing or being chased by in combat.
[/quote]
also we could make it that movement is only standard walking in the wilderness as thats where catching and movement matter.[/quote] walking is too slow on rs2, just set it running for all

item.title: Runescape Classic combat/rules in rs2/3 Engine
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Well, I’d play it if you added running. To disable running means you slow down a distance goal by 2x the regular running rate. That makes up for a lot of gameplay time because you are going to be running most of it. So, why would you disable running?

Read full topic
item.source: Runescape Classic combat/rules in rs2/3 Engine
